item.title: Building a tiny little broken calculator with parser combinators
item.description:
Perhaps I have a string lying around somewhere...

const testString = "Abcd123";

What a lovely little string.

I will start with a function that takes a string as input and tells you if the input passes some test you've set out for it. This is not yet a parser, not really. Usually, a parser does quite a lot mor...

item.title: Makin' wavs with Zig
item.description:

I've been gearing up to do some audio programming and more generally learn about digital signal processing. As a first exercise, I decided to revisit a simple program I wrote while trying out rust a...

item.title: Zig translate-c and linking equal best friends
item.description:
We have a weekly one hour interest group for Zig programming going at Recurse this batch. It's called the Zig Zone, which is both descriptive and alliterative. This is a pattern, other examples on my calendar include:

  • Rust Rodeo
  • OCaml Oasis
  • Clojure Conclave
  • Shader Shindig
  • Haskell Hangout
  • Django Discovery

Anyway you get the idea.

We all just show up wit...
